quizzes.title: History Quiz: College and St. Valentines Day
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, indy, college. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which college was eleventh to join the Big Ten Conference?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pennsylvania State University

questions.question: In the symbolic language of flowers, a rose of purple color given to someone on St. Valentines Day, signifies what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Love at first sight

questions.question: Which one is the second-oldest institution of higher education in the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William and Mary

questions.question: When Freud came to visit the USA, he lectured at this college.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clark

questions.question: According to ancient legends, the phrase Your Valentine, popular among lovers today, derived from St. Valentines expression of love for his sweetheart, shortly before he died. How did he express his love?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In a love note

questions.question: The day of February 14, 1929 remained in history not with its romantic atmosphere, but with one of the most publicized murders in the United States. Which famous American gangster stood behind these murders?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Al Capone

questions.question: In what song did Prince advise Baby Ure much 2 fast; U got to slow down.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Little Red Corvette

questions.question: He passed me on Doheny then I began to swerve

options.text: t I pulled her out and there we were-at Dead Mans Curve.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: XKE

questions.question: She should have gone to the library like she told her old man but shes too busy makin the Indy 500 look like a Roman chariot race, now. Too bad cause Daddy got wise (you shouldnt have lied, you shouldnt have lied) and there isnt going to be anymore Fun, Fun, Fun. What make of car did Daddy take away?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: T-Bird

questions.question: Which US state hosts the school known as the CIA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York

questions.question: This little beauty had three deuces and a four speed and a 389. Ronnie and the Daytonas
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pontiac

questions.question: This holiday is the Chinese equivalent of the Western, Saint Valentines Day.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Night of Sevens

questions.question: This female character, depicted by Shakespeare, delivers the following line in her insane speech: Tomorrow is Saint Valentines Day.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ophelia

questions.question: In the United States, this holiday is the humorous and somewhat sarcastic alternative to St. Valentines Day, also celebrated on February 14, but by those without a significant other.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Singles Awareness Day

questions.question: Everybody says that there is nobody meaner than this little old grandma from Pasadena.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Super Stock Dodge

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: School and America
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, college, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which first class passenger on the Titanic was a famous dress designer known as Lucile?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lady Cosmo Duff Gordon

questions.question: Which two states have an Albany State University?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York and Georgia

questions.question: What English city was actually the Titanics home port?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liverpool

questions.question: Which of these institutions has the lowest reported level of alcohol drinking on campus ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brigham Young University

questions.question: What were the Titanics wireless call letters?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: MGY

questions.question: It was at an abandoned part of the athletic fields of this U.S. college, that the first nuclear reactor was developed by Enrico Fermi.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: University of Chicago

questions.question: Lucy Hobbs was the first female dentist in America. From which school did she get her degree?

options.text: The Ohio College of Dental Surgery
The College of William and Mary  Medical Institute

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ohio College of Dental Surgery

questions.question: The Titanic had one steam turbine engine and two conventional steam engines.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This is the only school to win the NCAA basketball Championship and the NIT basketball tournaments in the same year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: City College of New York

questions.question: Which funnel on the RMS Titanic was a dummy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the fourth

questions.question: This is the only US state to have two Ivy League colleges.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York

questions.question: There was a visual difference between the Titanic and its sister ship, the Olympic.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which US state is Washington University located in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Missouri

questions.question: Elizabeth Swallow was the first woman professional chemist in America. From what school did she get her B.S. degree?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: MIT

questions.question: This college hosts the Institute for Advanced Study, one of the worlds leading centers for theoretical research and intellectual inquiry.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Princeton

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Flag and Year
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, officers, stars. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: There are two stars on the Panama flag.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What was the relationship between Thomas Andrews, Titanics chief designer and Lord Pirrie, chairman of Harland and Wolff, the shipyard that built Titanic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: nephew/uncle

questions.question: What year was the GTO first offered as an option package for a Pontiac vehicle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1964

questions.question: What was the funnel color of the White Star shipping company?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: black and buff

questions.question: Which of the Titanics officers is rumored to have killed himself?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Murdoch

questions.question: In what year did General Motors decide to drop GTO as a separate model and reinstate the GTO as an option package for the LeMans and LeMans sport coupes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1972

questions.question: What is pictured in the middle of the Lebanon flag?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tree

questions.question: What three colors are on the flag of France?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red, White and Blue

questions.question: The letter R was found in the middle of the old Rwanda flag.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What are the three colors of the Jamaican flag?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black, Yellow, and Green

questions.question: Pakistans flag has a star and what other symbol?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: crescent moon

questions.question: During the mid-late 60s Royal Pontiac (a car dealer in Royal Oaks, Michigan) offered a special tune-up package for the GTO 389 engine. What was the name of that performance package?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bobcat

questions.question: There are 52 stars on the United States flag.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In what year did General Motors decide to drop the GTO as an option package and add it to their vehicle lineup as a separate model series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1966

questions.question: The flags of what two countries look almost the same?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Italy and Mexico

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Leader and Jack
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, leader, festival. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which Pope was the spiritual leader of the anti-communist opposition in one of the former Eastern block countries in 1980s?

options.text: None - Roman Catholic Church backed the communist governments
Benedict XVI - because he was German and wanted to see his country unified
John Paul II - because he was Polish and wanted to see his country free
John Paul I - because he came from a family with long-standing anti-communist views

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Paul II - because he was Polish and wanted to see his country free

questions.question: Which of these characters that have become part of the imagery surrounding Halloween is not correctly matched with the author who depicted him?

options.text: All of them are correctly matched.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of them are correctly matched.

questions.question: Who was the US President when the Berlin Wall fell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Bush Sr.

questions.question: An old Irish Halloween tradition was to serve a dish called ‘colcannon’ with prizes hidden in it. What are the main ingredients of this traditional Irish dish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: mashed potatoes and cabbage

questions.question: What nationality were the immigrants that brought versions of the Halloween tradition to North America during the 1840s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Irish

questions.question: Who was the last leader of the Soviet Union?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mikhail Gorbachev

questions.question: What fictional character, created by Charles M. Schulz, believes in the Great Pumpkin and says, There are three things I have learned never to discuss with people: religion, politics, and the Great Pumpkin.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Linus van Pelt

questions.question: Helloween, one of the pioneering power metal bands, was formed in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Germany

questions.question: Who was the leader of the legendary Solidarność (Solidarity) labor union that led the efforts to end communist rule in Poland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lech Wałęsa

questions.question: Which of these Halloween events is not correctly matched with the place where it is held?

options.text: Terror Behind the Walls -  Madison, Wisconsin
Halloween on Franklin Street - Chapel Hill, North Carolina
Halloween in the Castro – San Francisco, California

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Terror Behind the Walls -  Madison, Wisconsin

questions.question: It is common lore that the Jack olantern originated from the tale of a drunkard known as Stingy Jack or Jack the Smith. Who did Jack manage to trap?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Devil

questions.question: What English author wrote the novel Halloween Party in which a girl is drowned in an apple-bobbing tub?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Agatha Christie

questions.question: The night before Halloween, known as Devils Night, is an integral part of this 1994 action-thriller film, set in Detroit.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Crow

questions.question: Which Chancellor united Germany in 1990?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Helmut Kohl

questions.question: Name the Gaelic festival of the dead from which Halloween originated.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Samhain

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Europe and Fall
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, pilgrims, festival. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which countrys all three neighbors were dissolved between 1990 and 1993?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poland

questions.question: Which of these events was first in the avalanche that swept away communist governments in Europe?

options.text: the execution of Nicolae Ceauşescu in Romania
the peaceful establishment of non-communist government in Poland
the fall of the Berlin Wall

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the peaceful establishment of non-communist government in Poland

questions.question: The first documented Thanksgiving ceremony in what was to become the United States of America took place in 1565 when a group of European settlers landed at St. Augustine, Florida. What nationality were these settlers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spanish

questions.question: The final act of the fall of communism in Europe was the accession of many former Eastern block countries to NATO and the European Union. When did the EU admit 8 of those countries?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1 May 2004

questions.question: What US President refused to issue Thanksgiving proclamations during his Presidency?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: Which term refers to the fall of communism in Czechoslovakia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Velvet Revolution

questions.question: In his satirical book “The Devils Dictionary”, this American journalist and writer defined turkey as “a large bird whose flesh, when eaten on certain religious anniversaries has the peculiar property of attesting piety and gratitude”.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ambrose Bierce

questions.question: Which former Soviet Republic was first to declare independence from the USSR?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lithuania

questions.question: What Native American tribe is said to have celebrated with the colonists the 1621 harvest festival, known as the First Thanksgiving Day”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wampanoag

questions.question: What is the meaning of the Latin word ‘pelegrinus’ from which the word ‘pilgrim’ originates?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: foreigner

questions.question: Which of these statements regarding Thanksgiving was made by an American President?

options.text: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
Sharing in Gods blessings is at the heart of Thanksgiving and at the core of the American spirit.
Let us remember that, as much has been given us, much will be expected from us, and that true homage comes from the heart as well as from the lips, and shows itself in deeds.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The Pilgrims, who established Plymouth Colony in 1620, were fleeing religious persecution in England, which was ruled at that time by this king.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James I

questions.question: All revolutions of the 1989 Autumn of Nations in Europe were rather peaceful. Which country was the only one to overthrow their communist regime violently?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Romania

questions.question: After 1989, with the dissolution of the Soviet Union, Czechoslovakia and Yugoslavia, many new countries appeared on the map of Europe. Which is not one of them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hungary

questions.question: Benjamin Franklin considered the turkey a much more respectable bird than the Bald Eagle. He expressed his disapproval with the choice of the Bald Eagle as the national emblem in a letter to whom?

options.text: the editor of the Albany Gazette

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: his daughter

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Thanksgiving Day and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, example, structure. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The origins of Thanksgiving Day can be traced back to harvest festivals that have been celebrated since ancient times. What is the meaning of the Anglo-Saxon word from which the word ‘harvest’ is derived?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: autumn

questions.question: In the movie “Scent of a Woman”, Lieutenant Colonel Frank Slade reveals to young Charlie, that his plan for the Thanksgiving holiday is: to stay in a first-class hotel, eat an agreeable meal, drink a nice glass of wine, visit his elder brother, make love to a terrific woman and then blow his brains out. Name the two actors who star in the movie.

options.text: Robert De Niro and Chris O’Donnell

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Al Pacino and Chris ODonnell

questions.question: Starting in 1970, what annual protest is held on Thanksgiving Day in the US?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The National Day of Mourning

questions.question: This Native American group often built homes that were 100 feet in length.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iroquois

questions.question: What poet, known as “The Woman in White”, wrote a Thanksgiving poem opening with these lines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emily Dickinson

questions.question: In order for a Native American group to be recognized, it must be submitted to extensive genealogical investigation.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This Thanksgiving poem is an example of which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: acrostic

questions.question: Non-Native Americans refer to this group as Delaware.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lenni-Lenape

questions.question: In the USA, Black Friday, the day after Thanksgiving, is one of the busiest retail shopping days of the year. What neologism refers to the Monday immediately following Black Friday?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cyber Monday

questions.question: What Academy Award and Grammy Award-winning song expresses the Native American belief that the earth is a living entity and people are connected to everything in nature?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Colors of the Wind

questions.question: What was the dominant type of Native American living structure in the Eastern United States and Canada?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The wigwam

questions.question: According to the 2003 US Census Bureau statistics, about  how many Americans classify themselves as Native Americans?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2,786,652

questions.question: What holiday observed in the US coincides with Thanksgiving Day in Canada?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Columbus Day

questions.question: Which of these movies tells a story that takes place within a 12-month period beginning and ending at Thanksgiving?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hannah and Her Sisters

questions.question: Which of these groups is the most populous in the USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Navajo
